findings.title: Iterations over variable-sized data structure may cause critical functions to fail if too many tokens registered
findings.description: The `GalleonPool` contract stores assets in a linked list and has several functions that iterate over these data structures. If this data structure grows too large, due to many tokens being registered with the pool, these iterations may hit the block gas limit, leading to transactions always reverting.

findings.title: GalleonPool.sol: Non-enforcement of ETH as the last element in the linked list may break escape protection
findings.description: The `escape()` function protection relies on assuming the ETH token entry will be inserted first, but there is no enforcement in the codebase to ensure this assumption, which can cause the protection mechanism to fail.
